Package sudoku

Interface SudokuSolver

All Known Implementing Classes:
SudokuBoard
public interface SudokuSolver
Sets guides for what a SodukoSolver should have.

  • Method Details

    • solve

      boolean solve()
      Solves the sudoku by setting the internal boxes to correct values.
      Returns:
      true if the sudoku is solveable

    • set

      void set(int row, int col, int digit)
      Puts digit in the box row, col.
      Parameters:
      row - The row
      col - The column
      digit - The digit to insert in box row, col
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if row, col or digit is outside the range [0..9]

    • get

      int get(int row, int col)
      Gets digit from row, column.
      Parameters:
      row - The row
      col - The column
      Returns:
      number at row, column

    • clear

      void clear(int row, int col)
      Clears box at (row,col)
      Parameters:
      row - The row
      col - The column

    • clearAll

      void clearAll()
      Clears all digits in the sudoku.

    • isValid

      boolean isValid(int row, int col)
      Checks that the digit in the the box follows the rules.
      Parameters:
      row - The row
      col - The column
      Returns:
      true if the digit in the box row, col follows the sudoku rules.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if row, col or digit is outside the range [0..9]

    • isAllValid

      boolean isAllValid()
      Checks if the numbers placed by the user follows the rules.
      Returns:
      false if the placed numbers breaks the rules.

    • setGrid

      void setGrid(int[][] m)
      Fills the grid with the digits in m. The digit 0 represents an empty box.
      Parameters:
      m - the matrix with the digits to insert
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if m has the wrong dimension or contains values outside the range [0..9]

    • getGrid

      int[][] getGrid()
      Returns the current grid of the board.
      Returns:
      2D array of the board.
